title: Sony, Gamestop hike prices on Playstation 5 in response to Japanese tariffs
description: Sony will raise prices of its PlayStation 5 consoles in the United States by around $50 from Thursday.
content:
Sony will raise prices of its PlayStation 5 consoles in the United States by around $50 from Thursday, as the Japanese conglomerate navigates a slow recovery in the videogame market while U.S. tariffs threaten to raise costs.

All three PlayStation 5 consoles will see a similar price hike, with the most expensive PS5 Pro version expected to cost $749.99, the company said in a blog post on Wednesday.

Gamestop followed suit on Thursday, announcing in a post on X that it had made the “difficult decision” to hike retail prices across its PlayStation 5 inventories, but accessory prices would remain the same.

The price changes come after U.S. President Donald Trump announced sweeping tariffs on imports from global manufacturing hubs such as China and Japan, leading to fears of supply chain disruptions and high material costs.

Sony had raised prices of its consoles in various European markets in April. Rival Xbox also hiked sticker prices of its consoles and accessories in the U.S., Europe, Australia and the UK a month later.

Consoles were expected to be a major driver of videogame market growth this year due to the launch of premium titles such as Take-Two Interactive’s “Grand Theft Auto VI” and Nintendo’s Switch 2.

But console price hikes and the delay of highly-anticipated “GTA VI” to next year have cast some doubt on the pace of growth in the industry.

On Wednesday, Sony said there are no price changes for other markets and prices of PlayStation 5 accessories remain unchanged.
summary: Sony is increasing its PlayStation 5 consoles in the US by around $50, with the most expensive version expected to cost $749.99. The move comes as U.S. President Donald Trump announces sweeping tariffs on imports from global manufacturing hubs such as China and Japan, leading to fears of supply chain disruptions and high material costs. Meanwhile, Gamestop has also announced that its retail prices will increase, while accessory prices will remain unchanged. The increase in console prices and the delay of highly anticipated "GTA VI" have negatively impacted the industry's growth.
shortSummary: Sony and Gamestop will raise PlayStation 5 consoles by $50 each in the United States due to rising costs due to Japanese tariffs.
argos_summary: Sony announced a $50 price increase for all PlayStation 5 models in the United States, with the PS5 Pro set to cost $749.99, citing a sluggish market recovery and potential tariff‑related cost pressures. Gamestop mirrored the move, raising retail prices while keeping accessories unchanged. The hikes come amid U.S. tariffs on imports from China and Japan, and follow similar price increases by Xbox in multiple regions. The combination of higher console prices and the delay of high‑profile titles like GTA VI has raised concerns about the pace of growth in the video‑game industry.
